p: A. membranacea (Labill.) DC. is one of the six species reported in Jordan [ 14]: it is distributed in the Irano-Turanian phytogeographic region, which includes Jordan, Palestine, Syria, Lebanon, Iraq and Turkey [ 15]. A. membranacea is a perennial herb. It has numerous stems (25–50 cm), is lignified in the basal section, exhibits pannose, linear, sessile and pinnatisect (1.5–6 cm × 0.3–0.6 cm) leaves, and has a capitula up to 20 mm and yellow ray florets [ 15].
